intro: Apalatoa bantamensis, commonly known as the Bantam daisy, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Apalatoa bantamensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
